member.name: P:Amplitude.Mercury.Terrain.Avatar.AvatarDepiction.BodyAnchorTransform
member.summary: Gets the Body anchor. This property trigger a synchronous load if necessary hence it can produce performance spike.

member.name: P:Amplitude.Mercury.Terrain.Avatar.AvatarDepiction.Theater
member.summary: Gets the AvatarDepictionTheater. This property trigger a synchronous load if necessary hence it can produce performance spike.

member.name: P:Amplitude.Mercury.Terrain.Avatar.AvatarDepiction.Body
member.summary: Gets the AvatarDepictionBody. This property trigger a synchronous load if necessary hence it can produce performance spike.

member.name: M:Amplitude.Mercury.Terrain.Avatar.AvatarSummaryLoader.Continue(Amplitude.Mercury.Terrain.Avatar.AvatarSummary.ComparisonFlags)
member.summary: Continue loading process. To do as long as this method return true.
member.param: Flag collection to force synchronous load of a particular part.
member.returns: Gets a value indicating if the loading is finished.

member.name: M:Amplitude.Mercury.Terrain.Edition.TerrainEditionModeBiomes.GetSelectedBiomeIndex
member.summary: Returns the corresponding world Biome index from the selected UI element.

member.name: M:Amplitude.Mercury.Terrain.Edition.TerrainEditionModeBiomes.GetPickedBiomeIndex
member.summary: Returns the corresponding UI element index for the picked data.

member.name: M:Amplitude.Mercury.Terrain.Edition.TerrainEditionModePOI.GetSelectedPOIIndex
member.summary: Returns the corresponding world POI index from the selected UI element.

member.name: M:Amplitude.Mercury.Terrain.Edition.TerrainEditionModePOI.GetPickedPOIIndex
member.summary: Returns the corresponding UI element index for the picked data.

member.name: M:Amplitude.Mercury.Terrain.Fx.IFxEvolverMaterialLevelBuild.ExtractNamesInfo(Amplitude.Mercury.Terrain.Fx.NameSets@,System.Int32)
member.param: A struct that contains all names set.
A integer to allows quick reject of multiple call of this function. The value should change each time it is used.

members.member:
Allow an overwrite of the natural wonder names when possible. It will produce invalid content of natural wonder so the user need to restore the whole content of terrain after this function call.
The list of the new natural wonder names. /// If convertData is true, it means that the provider needs to convert is internal hex data to use this new names. Get the success of the function. Some IWorldMapProvider aren't able to set those values.

Allow an overwrite of the Point of Interest names when possible. It will produce invalid content of Point of Interest type so the user need to restore the whole content of Point of Interest after this function call.
The list of the new poi type names. /// If convertData is true, it means that the provider needs to convert is internal hex data to use this new names. Get the success of the function. Some IWorldMapProvider aren't able to set those values.

Allow an overwrite of the terrain names when possible. It will produce invalid content of terrain type so the user need to restore the whole content of terrain after this function call.
The list of the new terrain type names. /// If convertData is true, it means that the provider needs to convert is internal hex data to use this new names. Get the success of the function. Some IWorldMapProvider aren't able to set those values.

member.name: M:Amplitude.Mercury.Terrain.IWorldMapBiomeProvider.SetBiomeNames(System.String[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allow an overwrite of the biome names when possible. if convertData == false It will produce invalid content of biomes so the user need to restore the whole content of biome after this function call.
member.param: The list of the new biome names.
If convertData is true, it means that the provider needs to convert is internal hex data to use this new names.
member.returns: Get the success of the function. Some IWorldMapProvider aren't able to set those values.
